means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 卡夫职业名称，制作或销售手套者，或绰号，戴特殊手套者，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“手套”(glove)
[人名] [爱尔兰姓氏] 卡夫盖尔语姓氏的英语形式，来源于别名，含义是“黑”(black)
[人名] [爱尔兰姓氏] 卡夫盖尔语姓氏的近似英译
[人名] [康沃尔人姓氏] 卡夫绰号，来源于康沃尔语，含义是“亲近的，和善的”(dear,kind)

word_mean: 套：围绕某部之小型带状结构

sentence.Network_en: Mr Baker was speaking off the cuff when he made those suggestions.
sentence.Network_cn: 贝克先生临时提出那些建议。

sentence.Network_en: He gave the dog a cuff.
sentence.Network_cn: 他轻轻地拍了拍那条狗。

jx.jx_en_mean: In an extemporaneous or informal manner.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting a glove or mitten): of unknown origin

entry.def: The cuffs of a shirt or dress are the parts at the ends of the sleeves, which are thicker than the rest of the sleeve.

example.ex: ...a pale blue shirt with white collar and cuffs.
example.tran: 有白色衣领和袖口的浅蓝色衬衫

entry.def: The cuffs on a pair of pants or trousers are the parts at the ends of the legs, which are folded up.

entry.tran: (通常指轻而快地)拍，击(头或耳部)
entry.def: If you cuff someone, you hit them quickly and lightly with your hand, usually on their head or their ear.

example.ex: Brodie cuffed him on the side of the head.
example.tran: 布罗迪拍了一下他的头。

entry.def: If the police cuff someone, they put handcuffs on them.

example.ex: She hoped they wouldn't cuff her hands behind her back.
example.tran: 她希望他们不要把她反铐起来。

entry.tran: 未经准备(或思考)的;即兴的
entry.def: An off-the-cuff remark is made without being prepared or thought about in advance.

example.ex: I didn't mean any offence. It was a flippant, off-the-cuff remark...
example.tran: 我并无冒犯之意。那只是随口说出的一句轻率话。

example.ex: Mr Baker was speaking off the cuff when he made those suggestions.
example.tran: 贝克先生临时提出那些建议。

means.word_mean: 1. the lap consisting of a turned-back hem encircling the end of the sleeve or leg
2. shackle that consists of a metal loop that can be locked around the wrist; usually used in pairs
2. confine or restrain with or as if with manacles or handcuffs;

sentences.sentence: "The police handcuffed the suspect at the scene of the crime"

means.word_mean: 掌打, 拳打,用手轻快地拍（某人）

sentences.en: She cuffed the boy on the side of the head.
sentences.cn: 她向这男孩的头上轻轻打了一巴掌。

jushi.english: Mother cuffed the dog when she found it asleep on a chair.
jushi.chinese: 母亲发现狗躺在椅子上时，便用巴掌打了它。
